itemDescription: Welsh rugby union footballer and administrator, and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: Peter J. Davies (30 December 1925 – 18 February 2014) was a Welsh rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1940s and 1950s, and rugby union administrator. He played club level rugby union (RU) for Ebbw Bridge Junction RFC and Newport RFC (vice-captain to Roy Burnett), in the back row, e.g. flanker, or number eight, i.e. number 6 or 7, or 8, and club level rugby league (RL) for Leigh (Heritage No. 635), as a goal-kicking player, he was later chairman, and then president, of Pill Harriers RFC,
